summary: This document is an email chain from April 2020 between a U.S. Attorney's office and the FBI regarding a new potential victim who contacted them. The victim reported meeting Jeffrey Epstein through Leon Black and being abused by Epstein starting when she was a minor. The emails request the FBI to reach out to the victim to obtain a statement.

persons.name: Ini
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, who received a call from a potential victim and forwarded the information to the FBI, requesting follow-up.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Identified by the victim as the person through whom she met Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual the victim reported being abused by, after being introduced through Leon Black.

connections.description: The victim reported meeting Epstein through Leon Black, indicating a social or acquaintance connection.
The victim reported being abused by Epstein for some time, starting when she was a minor.

events.title: Initial Victim Contact
events.description: An individual called the U.S. Attorney's office to report being abused by Jeffrey Epstein after meeting him through Leon Black, starting when she was a minor.

events.title: Follow-up Request to FBI
events.description: A follow-up email was sent to the FBI urging them to contact the victim who had previously reported abuse by Epstein.

keyFacts: A new potential victim contacted the U.S. Attorney's office in March 2020, reporting abuse by Jeffrey Epstein.
The victim stated she met Epstein through financier Leon Black.
The abuse reportedly started when the victim was a minor, approximately years ago (specific number redacted).
The Assistant U.S. Attorney forwarded the victim's contact information to the FBI with a request for follow-up.
The email chain indicates ongoing investigative activity related to Epstein victims as late as April 2020.
